Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an individual game player.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int playerNo, java.lang.String playerName, java.lang.Enum token, boolean cpu)
      This constructor creates the player with the given param values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int playerNo,
              java.lang.String playerName,
              java.lang.Enum token,
              boolean cpu)
        This constructor creates the player with the given param values.
        Parameters:
        playerNo - The player number (1-6).
        playerName - The name of the player.
        token - The token the player picked.
        cpu - A boolean stating whether the player is a cpu or not.

    • Method Detail

      • movePosition

        public void movePosition(int noOfSpaces)
        This method calculates the players "position". If their position is over 39 (past the bounds of the board array) then the number is %40 to start the player at the beginning of the board again. If the player passes go, passedGo() is called to perform the correct actions for passing go.
        Parameters:
        noOfSpaces - the number of spaces to move the player forward.

      • setMoney

        public void setMoney(int i)
        This method sets players money to the given param.
        Parameters:
        i - The total value of "money" to set to the player.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        This method gets the current position of the player.
        Returns:
        The position of the player.

      • getMoney

        public int getMoney()
        This method gets the total money the players owns.
        Returns:
        The amount of money the player currently has.

      • getPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        This method gets the players name.
        Returns:
        The players name

      • getPlayerNumber

        public int getPlayerNumber()
        This method gets the player number.
        Returns:
        The player number.

      • getPlayerToken

        public java.lang.Enum getPlayerToken()
        This method gets the players token
        Returns:
        The player's Enumerated Token.

      • isCPU

        public boolean isCPU()
        This method returns a boolean value referring to whether the player is a human or a computer.
        Returns:
        boolean value. true if computer, false if human.

      • drawCard

        public Card drawCard(Deck deck)
        This method draws a card from pot luck or opportunity knocks for the player. If the card is get out of jail free the card is added to a card array inside player, otherwise the card is returned.
        Parameters:
        deck - The deck of cards to draw a card from.
        Returns:
        Card object or null

      • moveToPosition

        public void moveToPosition(int position)
        This method moves the player to a set location. It is used when the player needs to move to a specific location without passing go, such as going to jail.
        Parameters:
        position - The position the player is being moved to.

      • setInJail

        public void setInJail()
        This method is used to set the jail boolean to true when a player is sent to jail.

      • setOutJail

        public void setOutJail()
        This method is used to set the jail boolean to false when a player comes out of jail.

      • keepCard

        public void keepCard(Card card)
        This method is used to "keep" the get out of jail free card.
        Parameters:
        card - The get out of jail free card to be assigned to the player.

      • returnCard

        public Card returnCard()
        This method is used to "use" the get out of jail free card.
        Returns:
        Card The get out of jail free card to be replaced at the bottom of the deck.
